sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Project GRC was for the holistic empowerment of unreached women . The project aimed at providing skill development training, low cost nutrition awarness amongst community women, health checkup, legal advise, non formal education, amongst several other time to time required and needbased activities for the socio economic empowerment of the women.

In Delhi, the GRCs came up as an initiative of Delhi Government, in order to make the city state governance more women friendly by Empowering women through social development, skill development training and financially inclusion activities, assisting vulnerable families and entitlement holders to access various service delivery and en-cash entitlement schemes of the State and Central Government.

The objective of the scheme is to empower and instill confidence among minority women, including their neighbours from other communities living in the same village/locality, by providing knowledge, tools and techniques for interacting with Government systems, banks and other institutions at all levels. 2.2 Empowerment of women from the minority communities and emboldening them to move out of the confines of their home and community and assume leadership roles and assert their rights.

detailsOfAchievement: The core sectors in which Deepalaya is active are (1)Education Different forms of education are provided by Deepalaya to children belonging to the marginalized sections of the society. In Formal education â€“ 3950 children are studying Deepalaya schools , In Non Formal â€“ 7669 children are educated, In the Mobile van â€“ 375 children are attended. So 11994 children from the disadvantaged background are currently getting education under various streams... (2)Gender Equity and women empowerment The Gender Equity program of Deepalaya is leveraging benefits to around 8800 members of around 700 SHGs which is spread over in Delhi, Uttarakhand and Haryana. This movement of women for economic and social upliftment has made significant changes in the socio economic conditions of around 360 villages of these states. (c) Community Health. Through its health intervention Deepalaya advocates for preventive and promotive aspects of health care among the most vulnerable groups of women and children from the Mewat region in Haryana, and slum clusters of Delhi. Every year the organization reaches out to more than 40000 people from these locations through services like rural and mobile clinic, awareness programs, health camps, immunization, behaviour change communication program etc. (d) Program for the Differently Abled In this sector, from the very beginning itself Deepalaya adopted a holistic approach to enable the inclusion of the differently Abled in the mainstream society. Apart from giving technical services like speech therapy, special education, occupational therapy and physiotherapy, the organization provided regular services to its clients for procuring certificates, aids & appliances, surgical services, and financial assistance for micro enterprises. Inclusive education was made as the focus of the education program for the children and a significant number of children were mainstreamed every year. (e) Vocational Training The vocational training program of Deepalaya gives emphasis on the capacity building of underprivileged youth from the disadvantaged communities of the society. In this regard Deepalaya run two full fledged vocational training Institutes and many training centers in its target locations. (f) Capacity Building of small and young NGOs Deepalaya Axis Bank Foundation program showcases another facet of Deepalayaâ€˜s programs where the organization imbibes values of professionalism, transparency and credibility among small grass root level NGOs. Here Deepalaya is expected to facilitate in identifying, enrolling, coaching and mainstreaming of around 4200 non school going children of 6 to 14 years of age. This is being done through building capacities of 10 grass root NGOs.

detailsOfAchievement: Our Activities OUR OBJECTIVES 1. To rehabilitate hearing impaired women and girls. 2. To provide technical training to improve their credential. 3. To give them an opportunity to prove themselves through our rehabilitative activities and talent competitions. 4. To provide a platform to ambitious deaf girls through beauty pageant. 5. To find the hidden talent in young deaf children. 6. To create awareness among common people. 7. To uplift the moral and sporting spirit among deaf and to bring overall personality development. 8. To improve their knowledge about various health issues like AIDS 9. To provide them independent life by providing job opportunity. 10. To encourage and develop culture and dramatics. 11. To develop vocational skills. 12. Counseling and Guidance CURRENT ACTIVITIES 1. Vocational and Technical Training DFDW vision is to cater to the school left outs, illiterate deaf girls from underprivileged families for vocational training. For this it conducts non formal Vocational and Technical training programmes for them so as to prepare them for employment in small scale and for self employment. 2. Non Formal Education This course is specially designed for providing basic reading and writing skills in English.Other than English we also organize educational visits like visit to Bank, National Museum, Visit to Other NGO etc. 3. Matrimonial Assistance (PRANAY MILAN SAMMELAN since 1991) is the main hold for all young deaf boys and girls as this is the only program were they get an opportunity to meet and find their right companion of their life. 4. Miss India Silent beauty queen and Princes Let see how beauty Pageant helped DEAF GIRLS 1. Young talented deaf girls got the opportunity to show their talent and feel at par with other normal hearing girls. 2. Their parents got encouraged to help their young deaf daughters to come out and explore the world. 3. They got good opportunities in Pvt. Jobs as well as Govt. Jobs 4. The winners got chance to model for magazines. They got recognition in the society. The media coverage bought them to the front pages of all newspapers from the closed doors of their houses. 5. An immense growth in their inne self and confidence. 6. Promoting Cultural & Sports activities We organize different programs to promote Sports among Deaf specially Deaf Women and young Children. Few of our events organized are 1. Deaf Child Talent Contest 2. National Sports Championship for Deaf Women 3. CONDUCT National Conference for Deaf and Cultural Festival of India For Deaf Women. 7.Guidance and Counseling LEGAL AWARNESS We help deaf students and their parents in resolving their problems and also in guiding them in what is good for their child. We also help deaf young girls in getting legal assistance through our legal advisor.

detailsOfAchievement: Delhi School of Social Work Society aims at promotion of education, research, training and action in the field of social welfare and development. The society is managed by member Board of Governors and headed by Prof, R.R.Singh as Chairperson and Prof, Ratna Verma as Vice Chairperson. Dr. Nira Agnimitra and Mrs. Sushma Batra are currently working as Secretary and Treasurer respectively. The society is continuing with its efforts on HIV/AIDS prevention project under NACP-IV with partnership of Delhi State Aids Control Society. The project is working with sex workers and also includes integrated counselling and testing center. Society has taken up various action and research project in the current year. It has supported CCDA by giving operational responsibility of Gender Resource Center and Suvidha Kendra with support of Mission Convergence of Delhi Government. It has also undertaken two research projects namely ; Christians of Scheduled Caste origin in India - A Study of their Socio-Economic, cultural and Political Status and Due Diligence Process for the CII Women Exemplar Award 2010 and The Society also encourages students through awards, medals and scholarships.

title: DRISHTIKON DANCE FOUNDATION
detailsOfAchievement: THE DRISHTIKON DANCE FOUNDATION HAS BEEN A PROFESSIONAL DANCE ORGANISATION WHICH HAS HAD A REPERTORY OF PROFESSIONAL DANCERS AND MUSICIANS, AND HAS HAD THE OPPORTUNITY OF REPRESENTING INDIA ON MANY INTERNATIONAL FORUMS AND THE PRIVILEGE OF PERFORMING IN MAJOR DANCE FESTIVALS ACROSS INDIA AND THE WORLD. WE STRIVE NOT ONLY TO REHEARSE AND PERFORM CLASSICAL KATHAK BUT ALSO TRY TO EXPAND BOUNDARIES, PUT IN CONTEMPORARY SENSIBILITIES AND EXPLORE A NEW BODY OF MOVEMENT. 80% OF OUR WORK AND PERFORMANCES ARE IN KATHAK AND 20@ IN CONTEMPORARY DANCE WHICH IS BASED ON KATHAK. THIS YEAR WE HAD BEEN INVITED TO PERFORM AT THE WORLDS LARGEST AND MOST PRESTIGIOUS ARTS FESTIVAL, THE EDINBURGH INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL 2012. WE ARE THE ONLY KATHAK DANCE COMPANY EXCEPT MAESTERO PT. BIRJU MAHARAJ, WHO HAS BEEN INVITED IN THE HISTORY OF THIS FESTIVAL. WE PRESENTED BOTH OF CLASSICAL AND CONTEMPORARY DANCE BASED ON KATHAK AT THIS FESTIVAL AND RECEIVED GREAT CRITICAL ACCLAIM. IN THE PAST COUPLE OF YEARS WE HAVE PRODUCED INNUMERABLE NEW PRODUCTIONS THAT HAVE BEEN BOTH CLASSICAL AND CONTEMPORARY IN NATURE AND PRESENTED MANY SOLOS AS WELL AS GROUP WORK. EVERY TWO YEARS WE PRESENT THE DRISHTIKON REPERTORY ARTISTS IN SOLOS/ GROUP WORK ALL CHOREOGRAPHED BY THE THEMSELVES. WE HAVE CONSISTENTLY COLLABORATED WITH WELL KNOWN ARTISTS IN INDIA AND AROUND THE GLOBE IN THE FIELD OF MUSIC, PAINTING, ARCHITECTURE, SCULPTURE AND DESIGN TO IMBIBE FROM THEIR INPUT AND TO USE THEIR EXPERTISE FOR EACH PRODUCTION. MANY OF THESE ARTISTS ARE NOT ONLY WELL KNOWN IN INDIA BUT HAVE AN INTERNATIONAL REPUTATION, SUCH AS USTAAD AMJAD ALI KHAN SAHEB, SHUBHA MUDGAL, ANEESH PARDHAN, VANI SUBRAMANIAN TO MENTION A FEW. WE HAVE COLLABORATED WITH SEVERAL INTERNATIONAL ARTISTS AND IN THE FUTURE WOULD LIKE TO CONTINUE TO DO SO, SO THAT IDEAS ARE EXCHANGED, CHALLENGED AND THE COMPANY BRINGS AN INTERNATIONAL FLAVOUR INTO IT WITHOUT LOOSING ITS ROOTS.
